Desmond Doss (US Army) refused to bear arms & fire weapons because of his beliefs. Yet he was awarded Medal of Honour for bravery in WWII. The movie Hacksaw Ridge was on him. Citizens (& soldiers) must watch it to understand how bravery goes much beyond...

@colken16 Try Hacksaw Ridge. Conscientious objector drafted into US pacific war as Medic. Saves 75 of his company, Who had beaten him up, gathers intel that enables capture of ridge, gets Medal of Honour, never picks up a rifle or fires a shot in anger.
All based on actual events
